nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils

Class DataIteratorHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.DataIteratorHelper

  • public class DataIteratorHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for data iterators
    Author:
    luis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataIteratorHelper() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void close(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator)
      Closes a data iterator.
      static void close(IteratorList<?> iteratorList)
      Closes the given IteratorList's underlying iterator, by invoking close(Iterator)
      static void close(java.util.List<?> list)
      Invokes close(Iterator) with the list iterator, handling IteratorLists by using IteratorList.getIterator()
      static void closeOpenIterators()
      Closes all open iterators in this thread
      static boolean hasOpenIteratorsRequiringOpenConnection()
      Returns whether there is at least one open iterator which requires an open connection
      static void registerOpen(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator, boolean requiresOpenConnection)
      Registers an open iterator for this thread, so that in future, it may be forcefully closed to avoid open data iterators

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • DataIteratorHelper

        public DataIteratorHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public static void close(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator)
        Closes a data iterator. Internally invokes Hibernate.close(), but exists to avoid clients having to rely on hibernate

      • close

        public static void close(IteratorList<?> iteratorList)
        Closes the given IteratorList's underlying iterator, by invoking close(Iterator)

      • close

        public static void close(java.util.List<?> list)
        Invokes close(Iterator) with the list iterator, handling IteratorLists by using IteratorList.getIterator()

      • closeOpenIterators

        public static void closeOpenIterators()
        Closes all open iterators in this thread

      • hasOpenIteratorsRequiringOpenConnection

        public static boolean hasOpenIteratorsRequiringOpenConnection()
        Returns whether there is at least one open iterator which requires an open connection

      • registerOpen

        public static void registerOpen(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator,
                boolean requiresOpenConnection)
        Registers an open iterator for this thread, so that in future, it may be forcefully closed to avoid open data iterators
